intro: Hordeum murinum subsp. glaucum, commonly known as mouse barley, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its glaucous, bluish-green foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous颖果 (glumes) that enclose the seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
